com.j2speed.async
Interface ExceptionHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
CompletionHandler, ProgressHandler<T>, ResponseHandler<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AsyncCompletion, AsyncProgress, AsyncResponse, CompletionAdapter, ExceptionAdapter, ProgressAdapter, ResponseAdapter
public interface ExceptionHandler

Handles the exception caught during the execution of an asynchronous computation.

Author:
Alex Nistico <alienisty(at)gmail.com>

Method Summary
 void onException(java.lang.Throwable exception)
          Handles the exception caught during the execution of an asynchronous computation.
 void onFinally()
          This method is always invoked at the end of a computation or an exception notification.
 

Method Detail

onException

void onException(@NonNull
                 java.lang.Throwable exception)
Handles the exception caught during the execution of an asynchronous computation.

TODO: add documentation for dynamic method extension for specific exception type handling.

This method supports the @RunOn annotation that causes the runner to call-back this method on the EDT.

Parameters:
exception - the exception to handle.

onFinally

void onFinally()
This method is always invoked at the end of a computation or an exception notification.

This method supports the @RunOn annotation that causes the runner to call-back this method on the EDT.

This is analogous to the finally keyword.
